data.expected: d) Urine microscopy for malignant cytology cells
data.sampled: : I would choose option c, Urine routine, as it is a quick and cost-effective method of investigating hematuria. Urine routine can show signs of infection or inflammation that could be causing hematuria. Urine microscopy can also be used but may not be as sensitive as a urine routine. A USG or X-ray KUB would not be as specific as investigating the cause of hematuria.<|im_end|>

data.sampled:
The answer is a) 1, 2, 3 True & 4, 5 false. 
Hirsutism affects approximately 25% of women and is caused by high levels of androgens. Virilization refers to a condition in which androgen levels are sufficiently high to cause additional signs and symptoms. Frequently, patients with growth hormone excess (i.e., acromegaly) present with hirsutism. Scores above 8 on the modified scale of Ferriman and Gallwey suggest excess androgen-mediated hair growth. The remaining statements are false.<|im_end|>

prompt.content:

Subject: Medicine

Which of the following statements are True/False? 1. Hirsutism, which is defined as androgen-dependent excessive male pattern hair growth, affects approximately 25% of women. 2. Virilization refers to a condition in which androgen levels are sufficiently high to cause additional signs and symptoms. 3. Frequently, patients with growth hormone excess (i.e., acromegaly) present with hirsutism. 4. A simple and commonly used method to grade hair growth is the modified scale of Ferriman and Gallwey. 5. Scores above 8 suggest excess androgen-mediated hair growth.

a) 1, 2, 3 True & 4, 5 false
b) 1, 3, 5 True & 2, 4 false
c) 2, 4, 5 True & 1, 3 false
d) 1, 2, 3, 4 True & 5 false

data.sampled: d) All are equal. A positively skewed curve has a fatter tail on the right, which means that it becomes rarer and rarer the further to the right you go. So the mode (if it exists) will be the value that occurs most frequently, but this will not be the value that is furthest to the right. The median will not be affected by the skew, so will still be a good measure of central tendency for a positively skewed curve. The mean will also not be affected by the skew, but it may not be the best measure of central tendency for this type of distribution.<|im_end|>

data.expected: a) Central aery of the retina
data.sampled: The answer is b) Infraorbital aery. The optic nerve receives its blood supply from the supraclinoidal cistern, which is located above the clinoid process in the temporal bone of the skull. The ophthalmic artery, which arises from the external carotid artery, passes behind the clinoid process and enters the supraclinoidal cistern. The supraclinoidal cistern then communicates with the cavernous sinus, which is the superior extension of the nasal cavity. The ophthalmic artery then branches into the anterior and posterior choroidal arteries, which supply blood to the choroid and retina, and further branches into the temporal and nasal choroidal arteries, which supply blood to the nasal and temporal regions of the eyeball. If a thrombus embolizes during surgery and lodges in the ophthalmic artery, it will block the blood flow to the optic nerve, resulting in blindness in the affected eye.<|im_end|>

Subject: Ophthalmology

Following endaerectomy on the right common carotid, a patient is found to be blind in the right eye. It is appears that a small thrombus embolized during surgery and lodged in the aery supplying the optic nerve. Which aery would be blocked?

a) Central aery of the retina
b) Infraorbital aery
c) Lacrimal aery
d) Nasociliary aretry

options: a) Central aery of the retina
